meanings.definition: To bring or put together to form a whole.
meanings.sent1: I joined the puzzle pieces to complete the picture.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter joined the pieces of wood to build a table.
meanings.sent3: The chef joined the ingredients in a magical way to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The stars joined in the night sky to form beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The students joined their efforts to clean up the classroom together.

meanings.definition: To become a member of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: She joined the book club to discuss her favorite stories.
meanings.sent2: He joined the soccer team to play with his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat joined the meeting of dogs, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The new employee joined the company, bringing fresh ideas.
meanings.sent5: The bird joined the flock, flying together in harmony.

meanings.sent1: The bridge joined the two sides of the river.
meanings.sent2: The handshake joined the two friends in a bond of friendship.
meanings.sent3: The magnet joined the paperclips in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: The music joined the hearts of the audience in a shared emotion.
meanings.sent5: The thread joined the fabric pieces, creating a beautiful quilt.
